channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Stanford’s star reporter takes on Silicon Valley’s ‘money-soaked’ startup culture
item.description: His reporting on a Stanford University president put Theo Baker on the map, but his upcoming book may cement his reputation as the rare young journali...

item.title: World launches its ‘super app,’ including crypto pay and encrypted chat features
item.description: Tools for Humanity, the company behind the app, is seeking to expand its "real human network."

item.title: Google launched its deepest AI research agent yet — on the same day OpenAI dropped GPT-5.2
item.description: For the first time, developers can embed Google's Deep Research tool, based on Gemini 3 Pro, into their own apps.

item.title: The 45 Best Movies on Hulu, WIRED's Picks (December 2025)
item.description: Gremlins, Home Alone, and Sovereign are just a few of the movies you need to watch on Hulu right now.

item.title: Epic Games’ Fortnite is back in US Google Play Store, as court partially reverses restrictions it won on iOS
item.description: The game is back on the Google Play Store, but another court decision is rolling back some of the developer-friendly changes on iOS.

item.title: Best Holiday Coffee Subscription Deals (2025): Atlas, Trade
item.description: Coffee subscriptions offer their steepest discounts in December—including on WIRED’s two favorite coffee subscriptions.

item.title: Doxers Posing as Cops Are Tricking Big Tech Firms Into Sharing People’s Private Data
item.description: A spoofed email address and an easily faked document is all it takes for major tech companies to hand over your most personal information.

item.title: The market has ‘switched’ and founders have the power now, VCs say
item.description: Graham & Walker’s Leslie Feinzaig and XYZ Venture’s Ross Fubini share the secrets for founders — and VCs — to make the most of the current fast pace o...

item.title: 1X struck a deal to send its ‘home’ humanoids to factories and warehouses
item.description: Despite launching as a humanoid robot designed to help consumers around the house, 1X's Neo robots are heading to industrial use cases.

item.title: The market has ‘switched’ and founders have the power now, VCs say
item.description: Graham & Walker’s Leslie Feinzaig and XYZ Venture’s Ross Fubini share the secrets for founders — and VCs — to make the most of the current fast pace o...
